intro: Cephaelis ceratoloba, commonly known as the horned cephalelis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Cephaelis ceratoloba is adapted to grow in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in humid, shaded environments.
